title: DIY paintcan pyrolysis kiln for making biochar during dry distillation.

tasks.task: Build a pyrolysis kiln for creating biochar, bone char, or oil from plastics and metals.
subtasks: Obtain components from hardware or sporting goods stores.
Acquire a turkey fryer with a variable flame regulator.
Construct a reaction vessel using a one-gallon paint can fitted with a lid and bulkhead fitting.
Insulate the top of the vessel using cement board reinforced with drywall screws.
Install a heat spreader plate at the bottom of the vessel for stability and structural integrity.
Position the reaction vessel over the burner to ensure even heat distribution.
Connect a condenser tube to the bulkhead fitting for gas condensation.
Prepare the reaction vessel by tamping down pyrolysis material and ensuring a good seal.
Collect condensed byproducts in a pan positioned below the condenser tube.
